articles.author: Sascha Pare
articles.title: The geology that holds up the Himalayas is not what we thought, scientists discover - Live Science
articles.description: A 100-year-old theory explaining how Asia can carry the huge weight of the Himalayas and Tibetan Plateau needs to be rewritten, a new study suggests.
articles.content:
Scientists may have just toppled a 100-year-old theory about what holds up the highest mountain range on Earth, new research shows.
The Himalayan mountains formed in the collision between the Asian … [+5517 chars]
